conversations.body_text: so i have just plugged the brake connector into the clutch port on the control box and the brake pedal still doesnt work

Hi，Ethan Howard，    I can’t see the side view of the brake very clearly. May I ask if you’ve made any adjustments to the brake damping or mechanical structure? We conduct thorough testing before shipping, so issues are generally rare. Please also check the base of the brake—there is a metal bracket secured with two M3 screws. It’s possible that the pressure sensor cable inside has come loose, which might be causing the problem.

A bolt was loose on the pedals all three so I tighten them. And the little
silver ball came out of the brake pedal. So I put that back in that’s about
it

On Mon, 9 Jun 2025 at 14:55, service@simsonn.com

Hi，Ethan Howard， We sincerely apologize for the loose screw issue. Please adjust the M6 screw located beneath the brake pedal's detent ball by turning it slowly. When the screw, as shown in the picture, moves up to the top position, it indicates the correct setting. At that point, the pedal should function properly.      Please refer to the position shown in the image below.
Hi Ethan Howard,  Did you fix it, if you still have problems, please let us know and we will fix it for you as soon as possible!
